titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: The Twentieth Century Cleric was founded in 1906. James W. Williams of Abington was the Cleric's first president. The group met regularly to hear papers and hold discussions on a variety of topics.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of minutes, 1906-1937 (3 volumes) of meetings of the Twentieth Century Cleric. Minutes include member lists, brief outlines of addresses, election of officers, memorial minutes, lists of speakers at Ladies Day meetings, and places of meetings. The collection also includes a roster of members and meeting notes, 1949-1953.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
